confession.seduction_date: six years before trial, during Holy Week (Sainte Semaine)
confession.seduction_context: Was in great need of grain for himself and family, went to Padoux to borrow but no one would help him. On return, met devil by wood called la Voivre. Devil promised to give him wheat and make him rich in exchange for service and renunciation of God. He soon repented and confessed at Easter to the curé or a helping neighbor.

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam
notable_quotes.french: Nicolas Adam je te cognois bien, s'il arrive quelque fortune sur moi, ou mes chevaux, je te publieray et t'accuseray si tost que je seray en ville
notable_quotes.english: Nicolas Adam I know you well, if any misfortune happens to me or my horses, I will publish and accuse you as soon as I am in town
notable_quotes.context: Bastien Hanna speaking to a hare he believed was Nicolas transformed

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam
notable_quotes.french: Monsieur j'en serois bien net, sans un meschant homme de Sercueur, qu'on appelloit Bernard
notable_quotes.english: Sir, I would be quite clear of this, except for a wicked man from Sercueur, who was called Bernard
notable_quotes.context: Adam's admission at Ognieville in response to accusation from Jean Grand Maire

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam
notable_quotes.french: qu'il en seroit bien net sans un certain qui luy avoit apprins a sonner du hault bois
notable_quotes.english: that he would be quite clear of it except for a certain person who had taught him to play the hautbois
notable_quotes.context: Another version of admission at Ogneville, linking his musical training to witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam
notable_quotes.french: qu'estant apprehendé on luy feroit sentir les tourments de la question et qu'il ne pourroit plus gaigner sa vie de sa pratique qu'il aimoit trop mieux mourir, et qu'alors il prieroit nous prevost de luy faire bander ses yeux, et puis l'harquebuser, afin de n'endurer tant de peines
notable_quotes.english: that being apprehended they would make him feel the torments of the question and that he could no longer earn his living from his practice, that he would much prefer to die, and that then he would beg our prévôt to have his eyes blindfolded and then shoot him with a harquebus, in order not to endure so many pains
notable_quotes.context: Mongete reporting Adam's fear of torture and preference for quick execution by firing squad

notable_quotes.speaker: Antoine Binaud d'Aidoile
notable_quotes.french: Lequel d'abord proposa qu'il ne sonneroit jamais plus feste que celle la, que luy ayant esté demandé par George Grand Maire de Padoux, pourquoy il tenoit tels propos, il dist pour ce qu'un soir ou un matin on l'iroit prendre prisonnier
notable_quotes.english: Who first proposed that he would never play another feast, when asked by George Grand Maire de Padoux why he held such words, he said because one evening or one morning someone would come to take him prisoner
notable_quotes.context: Adam's prophecy of his arrest at Dignonville while playing aubade

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam (in confession)
notable_quotes.french: que sont six ans a la Sainte Semaine se retrouvant fort necessiteux de grain pour son entretenement et de sa famille, il s'achemina au village de Padoux Bailliage d'Espinal, pour y en prendre, par prest, credit, ou autrement, et que neantmoins personne ne l'en auroit voulu accommoder, occasion qu'il s'en retourna tout fasché et contristé
notable_quotes.english: that six years ago during Holy Week, finding himself in great need of grain for his maintenance and that of his family, he went to the village of Padoux in the bailliage of Espinal to obtain some by loan, credit, or otherwise, and that nevertheless no one would help him, whereupon he returned quite angry and saddened
notable_quotes.context: Adam's confession about the circumstances that led to meeting the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Adam (about sabbat)
notable_quotes.french: Mais que tousiours luy ny ladite assistance n'y restoient, et n'en retournoient guieres joyeux, parce qu'ilz voyoient bien qu'ils estoient trompés
notable_quotes.english: But that always neither he nor the said attendees stayed there, and did not return very joyful, because they saw well that they were deceived
notable_quotes.context: Adam's description of disappointment and deception at the sabbat

economic_context.details: Nicolas was a professional musician (menestrier) who played hautbois at feasts. He was in severe economic distress - 6 years before trial was desperate for grain and no one would lend to him, which precipitated devil encounter. Bastien Hanna was trying to collect a debt from him. Antoine Binaud refused to lend him 6 ecus or stand surety for wheat loan. At arrest, all his property had been sold, room mortgaged; only possessed clothes, bed, utensils worth 16 francs plus 30 franc credit note.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally rich trial record with 27 witnesses, detailed testimony, confession, and execution. Notable features: (1) Nicolas was a professional musician (menestrier playing hautbois) whose occupation is central to the case; (2) He made quasi-confessions at Dignonville before arrest, repeatedly blaming 'Mre Bernard' for teaching him; (3) He expressed terror of torture and preference for firing squad; (4) Confession came without torture but under psychological pressure; (5) He wavered on naming accomplices, fearing revenge on his children; (6) Extreme poverty - all property sold before arrest; (7) Prior accusation by executed witch; (8) Multiple threats and harms over 18 years; (9) Incident with 'un gros noir homme' chasing him 6 years before; (10) Reputation as both musician and suspected witch for up to 18 years.
